did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes course material, publications, correspondence, and seminar material pertaining to Barr's career in the College of Human Ecology and his work on multicultural education and social injustices.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor emeritus of Policy Analysis and Management, formerly the Dept. of Human Service Studies, Cornell University

Don Barr was born May 7, 1935 in Geneva, Ohio. He earned a B.S. (1957) in social and earth sciences at Miami University in Ohio, an M.A. (1959) in sociology and a Ph.D. (1964) in guidance and counseling, both at Indiana University. When Barr first came to Cornell in 1971, he was the director of the college's office of counseling and admissions. Later, he moved to the Department of Human Service Studies (HSS), now called Policy Analysis and Management (PAM) and served a term as chair of this department.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes course material, publications, correspondence, and seminar material pertaining to Barr's career in the College of Human Ecology and his work on multicultural education and social injustices.
